title.value: Contrast-agnostic deep learning–based registration pipeline: Validation in spinal cord multimodal MRI data
title.justification: This is a direct extraction from the title of the research paper.
title.quote: Contrast-agnostic deep learning–based registration pipeline: Validation in spinal cord multimodal MRI data

extractions.description: This paper extends the SynthMorph method by developing a cascaded pipeline of two models for medical image registration, particularly focusing on MRI data of the spinal cord. It aims to provide an accurate and fast solution for multimodal 3D registration using unsupervised deep-learning methods, and it evaluates registration in challenging scenarios with both intra- and inter-subject data.

type.justification: The paper evaluates the proposed cascaded registration pipeline with experiments involving multimodal and unimodal spinal cord MRI data, demonstrating the practical application and performance of their approach against other methods.
type.quote: This work extends the original SynthMorph approach by implementing a registration method consisting of two cascaded models to accommodate images with large displacements. We evaluate this registration method in the context of SC registration...

name.justification: The paper focuses on medical image registration, specifically for multimodal MRI data of the spinal cord.
name.quote: Medical image registration can be challenging, in that optimal solutions depend on the application domain...

name.justification: The paper centers around the development and evaluation of a deep learning-based registration pipeline for medical images.
name.quote: This work extends the original SynthMorph approach by developing a cascaded pipeline of two models for image registration.

name.justification: Deep learning techniques are employed to improve the registration accuracy and speed for multimodal and unimodal MRI data.
name.quote: A particularly interesting feature is that training is performed on synthetic data so that registration becomes agnostic to image contrast and anatomy.

name.justification: SynthMorph is cited as an unsupervised deep learning-based registration method which the paper builds upon.
name.quote: SynthMorph was recently introduced as an unsupervised deep learning–based registration method.

is_contributed.justification: SynthMorph was introduced in previous research and is utilized in this paper as a baseline model.
is_contributed.quote: SynthMorph was recently introduced as an unsupervised deep learning–based registration method.

is_executed.justification: SynthMorph is not executed in this paper, but serves as a reference point for comparison.
is_executed.quote: SynthMorph method was implemented and adapted from the publicly available code at https://github.com/voxelmorph/voxelmorph.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the proposed method against SynthMorph, as one of its benchmarks.
is_compared.quote: The SynthMorph authors demonstrated... and deep-learning registration method, VoxelMorph (3), within contrasts and improves registration accuracy on multimodal data.

referenced_paper_title.value: SynthMorph: learning contrast-invariant registration without acquired images
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references SynthMorph as a previously introduced method on which this study builds.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Hoffmann et al. (9) introduced SynthMorph, in which training data are generated from a patch-based noise distribution.

name.justification: The paper evaluates its method against the spine-generic dataset, which is a publicly available dataset.
name.quote: Evaluation of the method was conducted on a publicly available dataset (spine-generic, 267 subjects)

referenced_paper_title.value: Open-access quantitative MRI data of the spinal cord and reproducibility across participants, sites and manufacturers
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced dataset is presented as an open-access resource within the research paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The pipeline was validated using a publicly available multi-subject dataset (19) acquired at 42 centers following the spine-generic protocol (20).

name.justification: The paper specifies that the training was implemented using TensorFlow/Keras.
name.quote: The networks were implemented using TensorFlow/Keras (17).

referenced_paper_title.value: TensorFlow: a system for large-scale machine learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference corresponds to the TensorFlow library, which is a common library for implementing deep learning models.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Abadi M, Barham P, Chen J, Chen Z, Davis A, Dean J, et al. TensorFlow: a system for large-scale machine learning.
